sentences.sContent: ...A couple of recent papers have finally opened a window on these people’s extraordinary minds...
...a couple of friends of mine who love biking as much as I do...
...failing to reapply after a couple of hours and staying in the sun too long...
...Last week I came across a couple of old school friends and we spend the entire journey in the bar...
...including a couple of fatty children with swollen cheeks pressing against their eyes...
...Last September the couple moved into a 1 500-square-foot home in Premier Gardens...
...In the next couple of years the businesses that thrive will be those that are tight with costs...
...That is the new offerings companies are pushing out the door every six months or so are me-too products or ones with just a couple of new features...
...as partners are more likely to become ill or die in the couple of years following their spouse’s death...
...I had been abroad a couple of times...
...There’re a couple of new grey areas...

phrases.pCn: 出人意料互不相配的一对

trans.tranOther: two people who are married or having a sexual or romantic relationship
